required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnosis and Characterization of Coronary Artery Stenosis by Doppler Ultrasound
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnosis and Characterization of Coronary Artery Stenosis by Transthoracic Doppler Ultrasound

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of acquisition of coronary blood flow velocity signals over the whole length of the LAD with transthoracic pulsed Doppler, and to evaluate the diagnostic power of the transthoracic Doppler analysis package for detecting and estimating the degree of coronary artery stenosis. Finally we hope to optimize the currently available analysis package on the basis of the comparison of the Doppler with the angiographic stenosis results and evaluation.

arm_group.description: Patients with an acute coronary syndrome that are candidates for coronary angiography. Doppler results will be compared to angiographic findings.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are clinically suspected of having significant coronary artery stenosis.
- Patients with CAD.
- Patients who are scheduled to undergo coronary angiography.
- Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with arrhythmia / irregular pulse
- Patients with unstable conditions: unstable angina, uncontrolled CHF
- Patients with COPD
- Any physical or medical disability that prevent lying in supine position
- Patients with chest wall deformity

facility.name: Coronary Care Unit, Heart Institute, Hille Yaffe Medical Center

clinical_study.keyword: A prospective study of a new diagnostic method.
Study consists of a transthoracic doppler of LAD.
Doppler to be performed prior to coronary angiography.
F/U doppler examination for those who undergo PCI.
Doppler results will be compared with coronary angiography.
